question: What is the measure of angle I-O1-K in radians?
qt_description: Angle I-O1-K formed by Line_O1_I and Line_K_O1 at vertex O1. Calculated using vector dot product (standard radian form, multiple of π).
description:
原始图形描述: Base shape is a regular 8-sided polygon (center O1) with side length 3, rotation angle 0 radians. Total 1 derivation rounds. Round 1: applying 'vertex_on_center' rule. Vertex-on-center derivation: 4-gon (center E) with radius equal to base 8-gon radius. Found 12 total points (including intersections). Geometry finalized: 4 new lines and 0 new arcs generated by splitting. Total lines: 16, total arcs: 0, total points: 12.
增强操作总轮数: 1
第 1 轮操作（共 1 步）:
  第 1 步: Connect points I and E (both on segments)
api_results:
Consider a regular octagon centered at point O1 with side length 3, oriented at 0 radians. A square is constructed such that its center is at point E — a vertex of the octagon — and its circumradius equals that of the octagon. Point I is a vertex of the square, and point K is another vertex of the square such that I and K are endpoints of a diagonal passing through E. Line segments O1–I and O1–K are drawn, forming angle ∠I–O1–K at vertex O1.

What is the measure of angle I–O1–K in radians? Express your answer as a multiple of π.
